intro: Marrubium hamatum, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain multiple seeds. Marrubium hamatum is often found in disturbed or nutrient-poor environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
